1.title: "Jor-El : Superman!"
1.author: E
1.appears_in: Nelson Bridwell, writer ; Wayne Boring, penciller ; Pablo Marcos, inker ; Ben Oda, letterer ; Gene D'Angelo, colorist ; Julius Schwartz, editor. 8 p. in Superman, no. 402 (Dec. 1984).

2.heading: Jor-el.
2.title: "Lois Lane's Childhood!"
2.author: [No author]
2.series: Lois Lane) 8 p. in Superman's Girl Friend Lois Lane, no. 26
notes: Appearances of Lucy Lane, Lois's parents, Superbaby, Jor-el, and Lara.

3.heading: Jor-El.
3.title: "The Lost Secrets of Krypton"
3.author: Wayne Boring, pencils ; Stan Kaye, inks ; Edmond Hamilton, script
notes: Villain is Lex Luthor; origin of Superman is retold; guest appearances of Jor-El, Lara, Jonathan and Martha Kent, in flashback.
Data from Bob Rivard and Lou Mougin via Grand Comic-Book Database.

4.heading: Jor-El.
4.title: "The New Superman"
4.author: Curt Swan, pencils ; George Klein, inks, Edmond Hamilton, story? 8 p
notes: Origin of Superman retold in brief.
Guest appearances of Jor-El and Lara (flashack). Guest star: Lana Lang.
Introduction and death of the New Superman (Ar-Val)
Introduction of Bran-Een.
Data from Bob Rivard, Martin O'Hearn, Lou Mougin via Grand Comic-Book Database.

5.heading: Jor-El.
5.title: "The Super-Teacher from Krypton"
5.author: Edmond Hamilton, script ; John Sikela, art
5.appears_in: 12 p. in Adventure Comics, no. 240 (Sept. 1957) ; reprinted in Superman Annual, no. 5 (Summer 1962); reprinted in DC Super-Stars, no. 12 (Feb. 1977).
notes: Summary: A robot teacher constructed by Jor-El comes to Earth to decide if Superboy is worthy of his powers.
Appearances of Jor-El, Lara, Lana Lang and Ma Kent.
Data from Bob Cherry, Gene Reed, Lou Mougin, et al., via Grand Comics Database Project.

6.heading: Jor-El.
6.title: "Tales of Green Kryptonite: No. 1"
6.author: Al Plastino, art ; Otto Binder, story
notes: Guest appearances of Beppo, Krypto, Jor-El, Lara, Jonathan and Martha Kent, Lana Lang, Lewis Lang (1st app. in Superman), Superboy, Lex Luthor (not a villain in this story; all flashbacks narrated by a piece of Green Kryptonite).
Data from Bob Rivard, Martin O'Hearn, Lou Mougin via Grand Comic-Book Database.

18.heading: Jord.
18.title: "Den II"
18.author: by Richard Corben
18.appears_in: p. 21-24 in Heavy Metal, v. 6, no. 1 (Apr. 1982).
notes: "When we last saw Tarn and Moda, they were in the presence of Jord, the leader of the Muvovum people. He was accompanied by his pet, Jordella, who took an instant liking to Moda. Unfortunately, the feelings weren't mutual, and Moda threw Jordella to the ground. With that, the guards carried him off. The rest remains to be seen."
"To be continued."

51.heading: Jordan, Ginger.
51.title: "Deferred Interest"
51.author: Alison Bechdel
51.appears_in: p. 38 in Between the Lines, no. 82 (Aug. 20-Sept. 2, 1998)
notes: Summary: Toni, Ginger and Clarice discuss home mortgages and marriage (legitimization by the patriarchy), Raffi has a toy sword that Sydney bought him, and later Clarice keeps thinking about Ginger.

52.heading: Jordan, Ginger.
52.title: "Famous Last Words"
52.author: Alison Bechdel
52.appears_in: p. 74-75 in Dykes to Watch Out for : the Sequel (Ithaca, N.Y. : Firebrand Books, 1992)
notes: Summary: Ginger has indulged in flirtatious behavior at the national lesbian conference, and says it's nothing; then Malika sends her roses. The cigar-smoking, anchor-tatooed delivery man says, "A Ginger Jordan live here, Sonny?" To which Lois replies, "Yes, she does! Thank you kindly, Ma'm!"

53.heading: Jordan, Ginger.
53.title: "Home Economics"
53.author: Alison Bechdel
53.appears_in: p. 38 in Between the Lines, no. 85 (Oct. 15-28, 1998)
notes: Summary: Clarice and Ginger are applying for mortgages, and also exchanging scorching gazes.

54.heading: Jordan, Ginger.
54.title: "The Iceman Cometh"
54.author: by Alison Bechdel.
notes: copyright 1998.

Summary: There's a storm, but Ginger makes it home safe. Sparrow has a date with a man (Stuart), whose car hits a phone pole and he arrives on foot and frozen. Lois promises not to carve a cucumber with a cleaver, and in fact gets ready to set up the Parcheesi board.

55.heading: Jordan, Ginger.
55.title: "Support Group"
55.author: Alison Bechdel
55.appears_in: p. 78-89 in Dykes to Watch Out for : the Sequel (Ithaca, N.Y. : Firebrand Books, 1992)
notes: Summary: Ginger struggles over interpreting and responding to the note that came with Malika's roses, while Lois and Sparrow offer a little too much help.

56.heading: Jordan, Ginger.
56.title: "Wing Ding"
56.author: by Alison Bechdel.
notes: Published June 1996 in Between the Lines.
Summary: Mo comes to a potluck with Lois and Ginger, not knowing that Sydney will be there; Sydney brings fried chicken and Mo gives her an "impassioned vegetarian diatribe."

136.heading: Jorh.
136.title: Olho Mágico : quadrinhos = Ojo Mágico : comix.
136.author: [No author]

publication info.publisher: Prefeitura Municipal ; Buenos Aires : Centro Cultural Recoleta

notes: Brings together works of comics artists of Buenos Aires and Porto Alegre. The originals of the works collected were exhibited in Buenos Aires in March 1998. Portuguese and Spanish language sections are bound back to back inverted.

Artists for Olho Mágico: Pedro Alice ; Allan Sieber ; Moa ; Kyoko Yamashita ; Sylvio Ayala ; Eduardo Oliveira ; Rodrigo Rosa ; Guazzelli ; Edgar Vasques ; Silvios ; Carlos Ferreiro ; Gilmar Fraga ; Santiago ; Fabio Zimbres.

Artists for Ojo Mágico: Gabriella Forcadell ; Pablo Sapia ; Isol ; Jorh ; Ricardo Siri ; Cristian ; Montenegro ; Cintia Vietto ; Langer ; Pares ; Diego Bianchi ; Fayo ; Pablo Ziccarello ; Pablo Besse ; Denise Turu ; Lucas Nine ; Dani the O ; Sergio Kern ; Elenio Pico ; Pablo Cabrera ; José Muñoz.
